security: The document is classified as TOP SECRET UMBRA and TOP SECRET DINAR, restricting access to a highly select group. Sharing this document would violate national security protocols designed to protect sensitive intelligence sources and methods.
summary: A message discussing President De Gaulle's positive reaction to President Kennedy's death, including his attendance at the funeral and messages to Mrs. Kennedy and the new U.S. President, which impressed colleagues and government members in Accra.
summary_one_paragraph: This TOP SECRET UMBRA document, dated December 2, 1963, reports on reactions to President John F. Kennedy's death, specifically noting that President De Gaulle's actions of attending the funeral in person and sending messages to Mrs. Kennedy and the new U.S. President made a positive impression on colleagues and government members in Accra. The message also mentions a religious service held in Accra for President Kennedy, attended by a large crowd and government officials, excluding the Cuban and Chinese ambassadors.
title: 3/0/FRD/T1193-63 DE GAULLE'S ATTITUDE AT TIME OF KENNEDY'S DEATH IMPRE [R]
